description: This trail seems to be the  most interesting after a good rain  the next day with clouds in the sky . Later in the year  it becomes a more arid trail  and dry typical Okanagan land scape.  So depending on what you like  it is still a great trail with views of the canyon below . The hiking trail is well used and seems to be cleared  once in a while . The trail is 5.42 km approx. one way
directions: From Hwy 97 west of Vernon  turn down Westside Road  heading south till you get to wpt  50.243991°  -119.450938° . Then head up Beau Road for 2.64 km  and turn westward onto Whiteman Road for 7.32 km. towards this end point you will cross a bridge  at wpt 50.218510° -119.515989°  heading SW.  You will get to another road that will take you south for 5.89 km. The next road at  wpt 50.175940°  -119.580729° will take south for 1.1 km. . Another road at wpt 50.167028° -119.583187° will take  0.78 km to the trail head parking. The road is 4x4 towards the end or exceptionally high clearance 2 wheel drive.
title: Shorts Creek Trail
